intro: Diosma thunbergiana, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Diosma thunbergiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun.
